Package se.arkalix.net.http.client

Class HttpClient.Builder

    public static class HttpClient.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder useful for creating HttpClient instances.

    • Method Detail

      • localSocketAddress

        public final HttpClient.Builder localSocketAddress​(java.net.InetSocketAddress socketAddress)
        Ensures that the identified local network interface is used by created HTTP clients by default.
        Parameters:
        socketAddress - Internet socket address associated with the preferred local network interface.
        Returns:
        This builder.

      • identity

        public final HttpClient.Builder identity​(OwnedIdentity identity)
        Sets owned identity to use for representing created HTTP clients.

        If insecure mode is not enabled and no identity is provided, client authentication is disabled for created HTTP clients, making them unsuitable for communicating with Arrowhead systems. The clients may, however, be used for communicating with arbitrary HTTP servers that do not require client authentication.

        Parameters:
        identity - Owned identity to use.
        Returns:
        This builder.
        See Also:
        Arrowhead Security

      • trustStore

        public final HttpClient.Builder trustStore​(TrustStore trustStore)
        Sets trust store to use for determining what systems are trusted to be communicated with by created HTTP clients.

        If insecure mode is not enabled and no trust store is provided, the default system trust store is used instead. This is typically suitable if wanting to communicate with regular HTTP servers over HTTPS.

        Parameters:
        trustStore - Trust store to use.
        Returns:
        This builder.
        See Also:
        Arrowhead Security

      • insecure

        public final HttpClient.Builder insecure()
        Explicitly enables insecure mode for this client.

        In insecure mode, no cryptography is used to establish identities or connections between systems. Usage of this mode is not advised for most kinds of production scenarios.

        Returns:
        This builder.
        See Also:
        Arrowhead Security

      • build

        public HttpClient build()
                 throws javax.net.ssl.SSLException
        Returns:
        New HttpClient.
        Throws:
        javax.net.ssl.SSLException
